Method Detail

extractAttributes

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> extractAttributes(java.lang.Object obj)
Generates a Map of all values that are retrievable via a getter having an XmlAttribute-annotation

Parameters:
obj - The object to extract Attributes from
Returns:
A mapping from String (Attribute-Name) to it’s value. May contain null-values if a getter threw an Exception
See Also:
XmlAttribute

extractCollections

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Collection<?>> extractCollections(java.lang.Object obj)
Generates a Map of all collections that are retrievable via a getter having an XmlCollection-annotation

Parameters:
obj - The object to extract collections from
Returns:
A Map that maps String keys to the retrieved Collections

public org.w3c.dom.Document newDocument()
Creates a new DOMDocument.

Returns:
An empty DOMDocument.

newDocument

public org.w3c.dom.Document newDocument(java.io.File file)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        org.xml.sax.SAXException
Creates a new DOMDocument from a given File.

Parameters:
file - The file to parse.
Returns:
A new DOMDocument representing the given File.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an IO error occured
org.xml.sax.SAXException - If an error occured on parsing, i.e. the document is not well-formed

newTransformer

public javax.xml.transform.Transformer newTransformer(java.io.File file)
                                               throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException
Creates a new XSLTransformer from a given File.

Parameters:
file - The file to look for an XSL-Template
Returns:
An XSL-Transformer containing the compiled XSL-Template
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException - If the Stylesheet contained errors
